Defend Democracy: Unite to Shut Down VT Yankee

March 22: Entergy: Your Time is Up!

Join us for a rally, march and demonstration at Entergy Headquarters, to mark the first day Vermont Yankee is operating against the will of the people. We view the continued operation of Vermont Yankee today as an insult to democracy, the people of Vermont and surrounding regions, and to the Earth.

The day will begin with a brief rally at Brattleboro Commons at 11:00 am. This will be followed by 3.5 mile walk up Rt. 5 (Putney Road) to Entergy Corporation’s Headquarters on Old Ferry Road. At that point there will be a nonviolent direct action where affinity groups trained in Non-violence will “Occupy Entergy”, crossing onto Entergy’s property. Supporters will encourage those risking arrest, from across the road on an acre of land we have been given permission to use for support services. The day will include much dramatic action including music, large puppetry, theater, creative costumes & messages for Entergy, demanding that Vermont Yankee nuclear reactor be shut down.  All participants in the nonviolent direct action are required to receive training in nonviolence and have previously joined an affinity group.  Click here for a list of FAQ

 

For more information see: SafeandGreenCampaign.

 

For a resource page from FN, see: Energy Pollution's Impact On Environment
